Detailed Description

This class is a widget class, to be used alongside any scrollable widget.

If you want to have buttons to accompany your scrollbar they'll automatically have their height match the width of the scrollbar if it's vertical, or their width match their height of the scrollbar if it's horizontal, based on the dimensions provided.
Scrollbars can come in a few styles. Separate is the typical way to present them with the Up or Left button being located at the top of left side of the scroller respectively. Together is where both scroll buttons are next to each other instead of on opposite sides of the scroller.

const Vector2  Position,
const Vector2  Size,
UI::ScrollbarStyle  Style,
UILayer *  parent 
)

Standard initialization constructor.

Parameters:
Name The name of this scrollbar.
Position A vector2 representing the top left position for this widget to be placed on screen.
Size A vector2 representing the size of this widget.
Style An enum value representing how you want your scrollbar constructed. See class details for more info.
parent The Layer that created this scrollbar.

Definition at line 705 of file uiscrollbar.cpp.

Real phys::UI::Scrollbar::GetScrollerValue (  )  [virtual]

Get the currnent scroll position represented by a value between 0 and 1.

For example, if the scroller is halfway down the limits it's allowed, this will return 0.5.
Like other values, the top and left represent origin(0) values.

Returns:
Returns the stored scroll position.

Definition at line 329 of file uiscrollbar.cpp.

void phys::UI::Scrollbar::SetPosition ( const Vector2  Position  )  [virtual]

Sets the relative position of this widget in pixels.

The position is relative to the screen size. Values range from 0.0 to 1.0.
The top and the left are considered the origin, thus values of 0 represent one of these points.

Parameters:
Position A vector2 representing the relative position of this widget.

Implements phys::UI::Widget.
